meanings.definition: Having or showing no moral principles; not honest or fair.
meanings.sent1: The unscrupulous man cheated his friends out of their money.
meanings.sent2: It is unscrupulous to take advantage of someone's kindness.
meanings.sent3: The unscrupulous squirrel stole all the nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her unscrupulous behavior was like a dark shadow over the community.
meanings.sent5: The unscrupulous character in the story made everyone uneasy.

meanings.definition: Acting without regard for what is right or wrong; lacking moral integrity.
meanings.sent1: The unscrupulous business owner exploited his employees for profit.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her unscrupulous tactics in achieving success.
meanings.sent3: The unscrupulous cat pretended to be stuck in a tree for attention.
meanings.sent4: The unscrupulous storm wreaked havoc on the small town.
meanings.sent5: His unscrupulous decision haunted him for years to come.
